title: Ping Spikes Make My Game Legitimately Unplayable
body:
So recently for the past couple weeks whenever I seem to enter a game at times everything seems smooth and fine, until i experience an EXTREME spike in my ping and from there my frame rate cannot keep up with the game.

 My internet connection is fine, my computer is virus free, and it is quite new. Just today, playing something as simple as poro king, my ms reached to a fucking 11 000 and I am NOT exaggerating that, it really did reach that number. I'm very unsure of what to do to fix this problem as I've tried quite a few simple option changes in my PC, and everything else runs just fine. If I can play gMod with flying colors, I should be able to play league without issues. I'm really hoping that the client update changes this tomorrow but until then, I really don't have any way to play league, which is a shame. I've seen others with this problem and it would be excellent to have a real solution to fix it. Until then i guess i can still watch league, but it's just not the same.

Thanks and good luck to those in search of a solution. 
{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

replies.body: Ping spikes over 9000 are a pretty clear sign that something interrupted your connection with our servers somehow. It doesn't mean your internet is bad, sometimes these hiccups happen, but luckily we have ways to figure out exactly what happened. There might be something going on with your network or DNS settings, but let's hit each step [**here**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to make sure we cover all our bases.
